content.description: Project 001 - The first project in this area

climbs.name: Pinche Corazon
climbs.fa: Manny Rangel, Rand Black, Kenn Noble

content.description: Two cruxes keep the start and finish difficult. The lower moves passing the roof are tricky but not too physical if you use your feet. The final moves are most difficult. Find the pinch above the heart, step up and gain the horizontal crack. Wander a bit right to summit.
content.location: This and Cool Whip are up and left of the main Whipper Wall.

content.description: Start in corner alcove behind rocks. Crack is in corner, follow hands crack up to offwidth and left out around the corner to a ledge with a bulge broken in half by fingers crack. Pass bulge into wide crack, which I found to be the crux. Offwidth and face climb to top. 2 bolt anchor with rap chains!Special thanks to Manuel Rangel and Crew for establishing the area!
content.protection: Double from .4 -3, one #5, two #6s. 2 bolt anchors with chains! Note: x2 #6 cams not necessary, on first ascent the leader only had one and reached down and back cleaned at least once. I did wish I I’d had  2 though.
content.location: Head to whipper wall. Noticeable route on the approach right as you come upon the crag. To the right of all the bolts in a small alcove corner.

content.description: Fun inverted dihedral with big moves between great holds. Some techy stemming and even a knee bar will help keep the pump at bay as you make your way up the overhanging wall. the first move off the deck and the crimp face sequence at the exit are the two distinct cruxes of the climb.
content.protection: Small gear would be recommended for this route as well as a #4 Camelot to sink in horizontal in the beginning. Other than that a rack of singles from .3-.75 should be find. The first move off the deck can be protected  with a purple metolious  tcu out right and a red BD C3 sinks into a great horizontal to protect the ending crux sequence.

content.description: The start is well protected by two bolts and the rock improves with height. Look for a purple camalot in a horizontal after the bolt. It's a ways but safe on big holds.
content.protection: Two bolts, fingers to a six camalot for final wide crack. Easy to use other gear but you won't feel as free to climb outside the OW.
content.location: From Whipper Wall go up and left to large patio below the first bolt.

content.description: West facing shady most of the day until late after noon. This wall is all overhanging and the approach is easy.
